FC_Shape Struct Reference
[Shape]

#include <shape.h>

Collaboration diagram for FC_Shape:

[legend]

Detailed Description

Shape Struct.

Description:

This struct holds information about shapes. Currently the info is about the sides of the shape only, which is skin information. If you want to keep the elements of the shape itself, then segment the mesh first to get that information and then call fc_getSubsetShapes on each segment separately.

Note that the order of the struct arrays and matrix matters, that is The 0th element of the face array is the same side as the 0th element of the elem array and is the same side as that referred to by the 0th row and col of the adjcency matrix.

Todo:
  • may want to have a struct that does that the shape innards as well (e.g., I use the innards in projecting the dead element region onto a side)
  • may want a method to do the segment first as well so the user doesnt have to call that separately, or add a method that can generate the shape elements for you afterwards once you have the shape.
  • may want to add edge info into the struct
Modifications:
  • 6/XX/06 ACG created.
  • 7/16/06 ACG dropped "skin" in name
